entries.text: Thank you for calling VeloFit customer service. How may I assist you today?
I want to return a VeloBand Pulse I bought a couple of weeks ago. It's not working the way I expected.
I understand. I'm happy to help with your return. Can you please provide me with your order number or the email address associated with your VeloFit account?
It's under john.doe@email.com. Look, I don't have all day. This VeloBand Pulse is a piece of junk, and I want my money back. I'm already annoyed I had to wait on hold.

Thank you, Mr. Doe. I've located your order. I see you purchased the VeloBand Pulse on June 1st. Our standard return policy is 90 days for most items. Let me just confirm the specifics for the VeloBand Pulse.
Okay, I have reviewed your order. Since it is well within our 90 days return policy, you're all set. I'll process the return for you right away.
Ninety days? Seriously? Good! I was worried. Some smart watch companies have ridiculous return policies. I've only had it fifteen days anyway. Just get the refund done.

Absolutely, Mr. Doe. I've initiated the return, and you should see the refund reflected in your account within 7-10 business days. A pre-paid shipping label has been emailed to john.doe@email.com. Please package the VeloBand Pulse securely and affix the label to the box before dropping it off at the designated carrier.
Okay, great. That sounds easy enough. Thanks.
You're welcome! Is there anything else I can help you with today, Mr. Doe?
No, that's it. Thanks for the quick help.
You're very welcome, Mr. Doe. Have a great day!
